physical_examinations.relevant_findings: General physical examination showed no abnormalities. Neurological examination revealed no muscle fasciculations; there was marked weakness of the hands, particularly finger and wrist extensors, and mild weakness of the elbow flexors and foot dorsiflexors bilaterally. The weakness was more prominent on the right side and in the distal than in the proximal muscles of the arms and legs. Deep-tendon reflexes were absent throughout, and there was no spasticity.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, the patient reported shaking of the hands that improved over time, followed by a progression of symptoms including cramping of the right hand and decreased endurance. Over the course of 1 month, there was a progression to loss of dexterity in the right hand.
